channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2025050415
item.description:
Report E-2025050415

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: S CHICAGO HEI
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking paper bag containing hazardous product, Maleic Anhydride. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimate 1lb release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’ x 4’ area as a result of forklift puncture. The contractor swept the released product and containerized into one 55-gallon DF along with the one punctured bag of product for waste disposal. The rest of the product was re-palletized and will ship on to the Consignee. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025050270
item.description:
Report E-2025050270

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: WHEELING
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of Ultramax Plus Precatalyzed Water White Lacquer Satin were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents, hand tools, cleaning agents, and absorbent pads to remediate the trailer interior. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050221
item.description:
Report E-2025050221

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 12ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and concrete dock and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to a forklift puncturing two (2) 5-gallon jerricans. Hepaco personnel removed all the freight from the trailer. Most of the product was at the nose of the trailer. The pH test revealed it was 0. Soda ash was deployed to neutralize the affected areas. The new pH reading for the trailer was 8-9. Three (3) 55-gallon poly drums were used to containerize empty jugs, impacted cardboard, bolts, fasteners, plastic wrap, absorbent pads, and PPE. Contractor personnel had to return to site because the terminal reported one of the drums reacted. All the drums were moved outside and filled with water under the supervision of the fire department. While Hepaco personnel waited for the temperature of the drums to cool down, they clean-up the affected concrete on the dock. The contents were contained into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and filled with water. After the temperature of the drums lowered, the terminal manager and chief of fire department declared the site was safe to leave. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050151
item.description:
Report E-2025050151

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 6, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately 20-gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for future disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: At 1824 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XDP. It was reported that approximately 1-oz of "JP-K81A" released from an ink cartridge due to a packaging defect. The release was contained to the cardboard box the product was in. XPO placed the waste inside of a 5-gallon poly drum. ERTS generated waste ID 233726-1.

item.title: Report E-2025050009
item.description:
Report E-2025050009

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail due to a nail that punctured the pail. The released material impacted the dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The impacted pail and remaining product were placed into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050005
item.description:
Report E-2025050005

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal bucket due to the container being damaged and leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the spill themselves. They gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
